title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 65.2 - Prohibited acts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 65.2 - Prohibited acts

State Regulations
(a) The
following acts are prohibited in all areas: (1)
launching a boat in any area other than
in designated access sites; (2)
parking a vehicle in any area other than in designated locations; (3)
parking a vehicle in any area unless the
person is fishing in the area; (4)
mooring a boat overnight, or beaching a boat in any area except under permit
from the Department of Environmental Conservation; (5)
camping or picnicking in any
area; (6)
building, maintaining or
using a fire in any area; or
(7)
depositing garbage, trash, or sewage, in any area, other than in receptacles
provided for such purposes. (b) Swimming is prohibited in Harwood Lake, Case Lake, New Albion Lake and Allen Lake. (c) No person may use a fuel power driven
water conveyance of any kind in White Pond, Harwood Lake, Case Lake, New Albion

Lake or Allen Lake. The use of electric motors, however, is
permitted. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
65.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
